intro: Lightfootia albanensis, commonly known as the Albanian lightfoot, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
